name: Estonia
description: Estonia, a Nordic country in Northern Europe, boasts a unique blend of Baltic and Scandinavian influences. Characterized by its flat, forested landscapes, numerous islands, and a rich history shaped by both German and Russian rule, Estonia offers a diverse range of experiences, from exploring medieval castles to enjoying the tranquility of its vast wilderness. Its strategic location on the Baltic Sea makes it a vital crossroads of cultures and trade.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The historic capital of Estonia, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
quickFacts.detail: Tallinn's Old Town is a remarkably well-preserved medieval city, offering a captivating glimpse into Estonia's past.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Estonia has a relatively small but highly educated population.
quickFacts.detail: Estonia boasts one of the highest rates of internet usage and digital literacy in the world.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Estonia is a relatively small country, making it easy to explore.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 46% of Estonia is covered by forests.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Estonian is a Finno-Ugric language, distinct from most other European languages.
quickFacts.detail: Russian is also widely spoken, particularly among older generations.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Estonian economy is heavily reliant on information technology and e-commerce.

climateData.title: Estonian Climate
climateData.description: Estonia experiences a temperate oceanic climate, characterized by warm summers and cool, cloudy winters. Rainfall is fairly evenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with snow melting and wildflowers blooming. It's a time of renewal and vibrant colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest and sunniest time of year, with long daylight hours. It's ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and stunning foliage displays. The forests transform into a tapestry of reds, oranges, and yellows.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cold and snowy, with short daylight hours. It's a time for cozy evenings and winter sports.

naturalWonders.name: Lahemaa National Park
naturalWonders.description: Lahemaa National Park is Estonia's oldest and largest national park, offering a diverse landscape of coastal forests, bogs, and historic manors. It's a haven for wildlife and a popular destination for nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a network of hiking trails, allowing visitors to explore the unique ecosystems of the Estonian coast.  The area is rich in folklore and traditional Estonian culture, with several well-preserved manor houses offering insights into the region's history.

naturalWonders.name: Soomaa National Park
naturalWonders.description: Soomaa National Park is renowned for its extensive network of floodplains and bogs, creating a unique and dynamic landscape. It's a paradise for birdwatchers and those seeking tranquility in nature.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: During the spring thaw, the floodplains of Soomaa rise dramatically, creating temporary islands and lakes. This phenomenon offers a truly unforgettable experience for visitors. The park is also home to a variety of rare and endangered species.

naturalWonders.name: Matsalu National Park
naturalWonders.description: Matsalu National Park is a vital wetland area on the Gulf of Finland, attracting a huge variety of migratory birds. It's a crucial stopover point for birds traveling between Europe and Asia.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park's diverse habitats, including salt marshes, reed beds, and open water, provide a rich feeding ground for numerous bird species. Visitors can enjoy birdwatching from observation towers and boardwalks, offering stunning views of the wetlands.

biodiversityCategory.name: Forest Biodiversity
biodiversityCategory.description: Estonia's extensive forests support a remarkable diversity of plant and animal life, playing a crucial role in the country's ecosystem.

statistics.details: Estonia boasts a high diversity of tree species, including spruce, pine, birch, and oak.
The forests are home to a variety of mammals, including the Eurasian lynx, red deer, and wild boar.

notableSpecies.name: Eurasian Lynx
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the Estonian forests, playing a vital role in maintaining ecosystem balance.

notableSpecies.name: Red Deer
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Estonian wilderness, contributing to forest regeneration.

ecosystemData.title: Estonian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Estonia's ecosystems are characterized by a mosaic of forests, wetlands, and coastal habitats, each supporting a unique array of species. The country's commitment to conservation is evident in its extensive network of protected areas.

biodiversityCategories.description: Estonia's extensive forests support a remarkable diversity of plant and animal life.

statistics.details: Estonia boasts a high diversity of tree species.
The forests are home to a variety of mammals.

notableSpecies.name: Eurasian Lynx
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the Estonian forests.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetland Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Estonia's wetlands, including bogs and marshes, are vital habitats for a wide range of species.

statistics.details: The wetlands are a crucial stopover point for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Whooper Swan
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory bird that relies on Estonian wetlands for breeding and feeding.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Estonia
activities.description: Estonia offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and cycling to water sports and wildlife watching.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Estonia's diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Coastal Hiking
activities.description: Enjoy scenic coastal trails with stunning views of the Baltic Sea.

activities.name: Forest Hiking
activities.description: Discover Estonia's ancient forests and hidden trails.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Baltic Sea and Estonia's numerous lakes and rivers.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and hidden coves by kayak.

activities.name: Swimming
activities.description: Take a refreshing dip in the Baltic Sea.
